title: Local obituary: Jaylin Rainford, 20, Catholic Memorial grad and Bryant University junior
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Jaylin Rainford, 20, a Bryant University junior studying finance and Catholic Memorial graduate, passed away unexpectedly on January 25, 2026.
Rainford was known for his intelligence, humility, and generous spirit, with interests in soccer and track and field.
Funeral services will be on February 7, 2026, at St. Mary Church, Randolph, with burial at Central Cemetery.

title: Drake Maye says he got Super Bowl schedule advice from a former Patriots rival
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye received Super Bowl schedule advice from Peyton Manning to maintain consistency before the big game.
Maye recalled witnessing Manning's Super Bowl 50 win at Levi's Stadium as a Carolina Panthers fan.
Drake Maye appreciates NFL veterans reaching out to help him prepare for his first Super Bowl appearance.

title: Here’s what to expect these remaining weeks of winter, according to Dave Epstein
author: David Epstein
bullets: Temperatures in New England are expected to remain below average through early March, with a potential warm-up in mid-February.
Boston received above-average snowfall in January, with February expected to follow a similar pattern of cold and snow.
Despite the cold and snow, daylight hours are increasing, signaling a gradual transition towards warmer spring conditions.

title: Kayshon Boutte gives a blunt reason for his breakout season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kayshon Boutte attributes his breakout season to quarterback Drake Maye, who became a legitimate MVP candidate.
Despite injuries, Boutte achieved 551 receiving yards and six touchdowns, averaging 17 yards per catch, third in the NFL.
In playoffs, Boutte led Patriots with 147 receiving yards, including a memorable one-handed touchdown against the Texans.

title: Joe Milton says he felt ‘disrespected’ by Patriots, Jerod Mayo before trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Joe Milton felt disrespected by the Patriots and requested a trade after limited play in his rookie season.
Milton was drafted in the sixth round of the 2024 NFL Draft and wanted more opportunities to develop.
After the trade, Milton served as Dak Prescott's backup for the Dallas Cowboys, appearing in four games.

title: Massachusetts native Josh D’Amaro chosen as Disney’s new CEO
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Josh D'Amaro, a Massachusetts native and Medfield High alum, will become Disney's new CEO on March 18.
D'Amaro has been with Disney since 1998, overseeing theme parks, cruises, and digital ventures, including a Fortnite collaboration.
He succeeds Robert Iger after a multi-year internal and external candidate review by Disney's board of directors.

title: Where does Marcus Jones rank among the best two-way players in Patriots history?
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Marcus Jones is third among the best two-way players in Patriots history with notable versatility on defense and special teams.
Jones has a record 14.6 yards per punt return and six touchdowns in his first four NFL seasons with the Patriots.
Mike Vrabel leads as the top two-way player, with an impressive 10 touchdowns as an occasional tight end alongside his role as linebacker.

title: These are the best Cape Cod chips, according to readers
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Campbell's announced the closure of the Cape Cod chips facility in Hyannis, Massachusetts, set for April.
Boston.com readers ranked the Original Cape Cod Potato Chips as their favorite flavor, followed by Dark Russet.
Nearly 1,000 readers participated, expressing preferences for various flavors, including Sea Salt & Cracked Pepper and Sea Salt & Vinegar.

title: High-end supermarket opening first Mass. location, alongside drive-thru coffee shop’s second
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Sprouts Farmers Market and 7 Brew are set to open in Weymouth, Massachusetts, replacing a vacant Honda dealership.
The project received approvals from Weymouth's Board of Zoning Appeals and Conservation Commission, with construction starting this spring.
Sprouts will open its first New England location, while 7 Brew will launch its second site in Massachusetts.

title: Sick of winter? Here’s what spring will look like in New England, per the Old Farmer’s Almanac
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The Old Farmer's Almanac predicts warmer and drier conditions for New England this spring.
Average temperatures in May are forecast to be about 3°F above normal in the Northeast.
Precipitation levels are expected to be below average from April through May in New England.
